## 2.1

1. $U(x,y) = 4x^2 + 3y^2$
    a. $\frac{\partial U}{\partial x} = 8x$
    b. $\frac{\partial U}{\partial x} \Big|_ \left(1,2\right)   = 8$ ;
       $\frac{\partial U}{\partial y} \Big|_ \left(1,2\right)   = 12$
    c. $dU = \frac{\partial U}{\partial x}dx + \frac{\partial U}{\partial y}dy$ \
       $dU =8xdx + 6ydy$
    d. $0 = 8xdx + 6ydy$ \
        $-8xdx = 6ydy$ \
        $- \frac{4}{3}\frac{x}{y} = \frac{dy}{dx}$
        
    e.  $U(1,2) = 4*1^2 + 3*2^2 = 4 + 12 = 16$
    f. $-\frac{4}{3}*\frac{1}{2} = -\frac{2}{3} = \frac{dy}{dx}$
    g. contour line is on an elipse $16 = 4x^2 +3y^2 \rightarrow 16 - 4x^2 = 3y^2$
        $\rightarrow  y = \pm \frac{2}{ \sqrt3}\sqrt{4 - x^2}$ This is the equation of the elipse as a function of $x$. \
        $$\frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{1}{\sqrt3} \left( 4- x^2 \right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}\left(-2x\right) =   \frac{2}{\sqrt3}\left( 4- x^2 \right)^{-\frac{1}{2}}x $$
        is the slope of the contour line.
